title: ‘Big Girl, Small Town’ Review: Salt of the Earth
sub_head: The Troubles may be over, but Michelle Gallen’s heroine has problems all her own.
body: Majella O’Neill’s life is as unremarkable as life can be in a town like Aghybogey in the wake of the Troubles. Her father disappeared 10 years ago (“disappeared” in this locality being a euphemism for getting yourself killed), her uncle Bobby blew himself up while planting a bomb and her grandfather died from wounds conferred on him in a British internment camp. “Throughout her childhood,” Majella concedes, “the local news had been a litany of deaths, explosions and murder attempts.” But this is Northern Ireland in the year 2000, paramilitary ceasefires are holding, and when Majella’s grandmother is found dead it looks...
